cell.title: A Simple interact
cell.description: An example of a control using the simple syntax.

cell.title: Simple Graphics Output
cell.description: A slider that controls a 2d plot. Move the slider around to change the plot.
cell.input: @interact def f(n=ContinuousSlider( interval=(-2,2), stepsize=0.15)): html('n = '+str(n)) print 'stdout', n plot(sin(n*x), x, 0, 2*pi).show()

cell.title: A Complicated interact
cell.description: Multiple interactive controls that work together to produce an output. The output is returned both as a HTML element and as a print()'ed string.

cell.title: Taylor Series
cell.description: An interactive demonstration of the Taylor series truncated at different degrees.
cell.input: var('x') x0 = 0 f = sin(x)*e^(-x) p = plot(f,-1,5, thickness=2) dot = point((x0,f(x=x0)),pointsize=80,rgbcolor=(1,0,0)) @interact def _(order=(1..12)): ft = f.taylor(x,x0,order) pt = plot(ft,-1, 5, color='green', thickness=2) html('$f(x)\;=\;%s$'%latex(f)) html('$\hat{f}(x;%s)\;=\;%s+\mathcal{O}(x^{%s})$'%(x0,latex(ft),order+1)) show(dot + p + pt, ymin = -.5, ymax = 1)
